bibl.title: Monetisation, not Price-Inflation, in Third-Century A.D. Egypt?
Cathy E. KING and David G. WIGG (Edd.), Coin Finds and Coin Use in the Roman World. The Thirteenth Oxford Symposium on Coinage and Monetary History, 25.-27.3.1993. A NATO Advanced Research Workshop
bibl.author: RATHBONE, Dominic

bibl.note: "It is not safe to believe that the third-century empire in general suffered from serious price-inflation before the 270s, nor that as a general principle the increasing supply of coinage and its reductions in weight and fineness are likely to have led to price-inflation."
RATHBONE Dominic, Monetisation, not Price-Inflation, in Third-Century A.D. Egypt?

Cathy E. KING and David G. WIGG (Edd.), Coin Finds and Coin Use in the Roman World. The Thirteenth Oxford Symposium on Coinage and Monetary History, 25.-27.3.1993. A NATO Advanced Research Workshop = Studien zu Fundmünzen der Antike. 10 (Berlin, 1996) pp. 321-339, 2 figg.
